Player History
Had first career hit on 4/7/1985, off Luis DeLeon (SD)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/27/1985, off Teddy Higuera (CIN)...
Injured on 6/16/1986 with a Inflamed Groin Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
2/2/1987: Gets a new one-year contract worth $1,378,571 through salary arbitration...
Traded from Chicago to Toronto on 6/9/1987 (Going to CHC: P Mike Remlinger, SS Andujar Cedeno. Going to TOR: SS Shawon Dunston)...
Won World Series with Toronto in 1987...
2/2/1988: Gets a new one-year contract worth $1,378,571 through salary arbitration...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/10/1988, hitting .529 with 2 HR, 7 RBI...
Drove in 6 runs against Detroit on 4/10/1988...
Was selected to the 1988 Allstar game...
Drove in 6 runs against Boston on 9/16/1988...
2/2/1989: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,564,286 through salary arbitration...
8/20/1989: Signed a contract extension with Toronto, $4,390,000 per year, for 4 years.
Won Gold Glove Award at Third Base in 1989...
Drove in 6 runs against New York (Y) on 7/15/1990...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/17/1990, hitting .500 with 2 HR, 11 RBI...
